body_html:
This possibility of filling large amount of disk space while using tfdbg to debug certain models is documented in this FAQ section: https://www.tensorflow.org/programmers_guide/debugger#frequently_asked_questions,

under the heading
Q: The model I am debugging is very large. The data dumped by tfdbg fills up the free space of my disk. What can I do?

But I'm considering adding a configurable cap on how much disk space tfdbg consumes by default.
body_text:
This possibility of filling large amount of disk space while using tfdbg to debug certain models is documented in this FAQ section: https://www.tensorflow.org/programmers_guide/debugger#frequently_asked_questions,
under the heading
Q: The model I am debugging is very large. The data dumped by tfdbg fills up the free space of my disk. What can I do?
But I'm considering adding a configurable cap on how much disk space tfdbg consumes by default.
body:
This possibility of filling large amount of disk space while using tfdbg to debug certain models is documented in this FAQ section: https://www.tensorflow.org/programmers_guide/debugger#frequently_asked_questions,

under the heading 
Q: The model I am debugging is very large. The data dumped by tfdbg fills up the free space of my disk. What can I do?

But I'm considering adding a configurable cap on how much disk space tfdbg consumes by default.
